content: The Act titled "District of Columbia Budget Autonomy Act of 2003" amends Section 446 of the District of Columbia Home Rule Act regarding the enactment of the local budget. The Council must adopt the annual budget for the District of Columbia government within 50 days of receiving the proposal from the Mayor. Any supplements must also be adopted after a public hearing. During control years, the budget adopted must be submitted by the Mayor to the President for transmission to Congress. During control years, the Mayor must submit the adopted budget to the President for transmission to Congress, following specific budget procedures outlined in the Act. Any general provision in a general appropriation bill for Federal payments to the District of Columbia will remain in effect until the enactment of a new bill for the following fiscal year. SEC. 7. EFFECTIVE DATE. The amendments made by this Act will apply to the District of Columbia budgets for fiscal years starting on or after October 1, 2004.
